derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Latin corporatus, past participle of corporare 'form into a body', from corpus, corpor- 'body'

entry.def: Corporate means relating to business corporations or to a particular business corporation.

means.word_mean: 1. of or belonging to a corporation;
2. possessing or existing in bodily form;

sentences.sentence: "what seemed corporal melted as breath into the wind"- Shakespeare

means.word_mean: 3. done by or characteristic of individuals acting together;
4. organized and maintained as a legal corporation;

sentences.sentence: "a special agency set up in corporate form"
